summary: The iteration-2 blocking contradiction around removing v4.6.0 JWT vectors during the dual-accept window is fixed correctly, and no new truly blocking issues were introduced in this revision.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: SHA pinning was ambiguous (tag/main allowed) and could make builds non-reproducible
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 1.1 still explicitly requires resolving the v7.0.0 tag to an immutable commit SHA, pinning to that SHA in package.json, and verifying lockfile/CI regex gates.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: JWT migration removed v4.6.0 compatibility without a dual-accept window, TTL strategy, and telemetry
previous_issues_status.notes: Tasks 2.1 and 2.7 retain dual-accept (v4.6.0 trust_level + v7 trust_scopes), single-write v7, and a bounded telemetry-based cutoff policy tied to TTL.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: NftId canonicalization lacked DB/backfill + read-compat plan
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 2.3 includes inventory, dual-read/single-write, idempotent backfill with collision/ambiguity handling, and integration tests for old-format accessibility.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: No concrete S2S peer verification/compatibility window against real loa-finn deployments
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 4.9 defines a pre-deploy verification gate plus a bounded dual-accept policy for v6.x/7.0.0 and requires integration tests for both peer versions.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: SSE/Completion wire changes lacked end-to-end integration tests (stub-only risk)
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 4.10 adds transcript replay tests, forward-compat unknown event handling, and ajv schema validation for CompletionRequest/Result.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Duplicate task IDs created sequencing ambiguity
previous_issues_status.notes: Task numbering remains unique and cross-references appear consistent in this revision.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Auth-migration contradiction: Sprint 4.5 removed v4.6.0 JWT test vectors while Sprint 2 required dual-accept during telemetry window
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 4.5 now explicitly keeps v4.6.0 dual-accept vectors and annotates removal as gated on the Task 2.7 telemetry cutoff; Task 4.8/NOTES.md also reflects that removal is deferred post-cutoff.
